titleInfo.title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-12-15 - WSM

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. The file may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed without permission. End users must obtain all required permissions or consents from the owners of such rights. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: First part of recording contains a segment of a Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 15, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (performer/host), Rod Brasfield (performer), Ferlin Husky as Simon Crum (performer), Tommy Jackson (performer), Minnie Pearl (performer), and Chet Atkins (performer), held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Second part of recording contains a segment of a Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 8, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Marty Robbins (host/performer), Lonzo & Oscar (performers), Rod Brasfield (performer), the Jordanaires (performers), Chet Atkins (performer), June Carter (performer), and Del Wood (performer). Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 922nd broadcast.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS v3.5 from a Qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America.
